result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan J Beastrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide DNA sample; complete AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within first year of probation.

nothing further

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Nathan J Beastrom with Attorney Charles S. Huff appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Hanna - Clerk 11:46 am 
Huff - deft has open case in Pierce Co. - believe that county is waiting to see what deft gets sentenced to in this matter 
State - gives sentencing recommendations - w/held sentence - 2 years probation - 30 days jail - $518 cc - AODA and follow thru - Provide DNA sample 
Huff - makes sentencing arguments on jail time - agrees with the probation - just asking for probation or imposed and stayed jail sentence 
Huff - 4 days jail credit
State - no objection for 4 days jail credit 

COURT - w/held sentence - 2 years probation 
Orders 50 hours of community service to be completed w/in first year of pprobation 
AODA and follow thru with any recommendations
$268 cc 
$250 dna surchg
**apply bond**

4 days credit
